answers.answer: I'm sorry you can't work.  There is certainly $$ concerns, I'm sure, as well as the loss of independence.You have been lucky so far, indeed.  You'll be on bedrest soon, so start stocking up on crossword puzzles, Sudoku, DVD's, and find some great tv shows to watch.I hope everything continues well for you!

First off congrats on the babies! I understand not working can be stressful, I haven't been able to work my whole pregnancy and since I was at my job for less then a year I got let go with no disability pay or anything. I would think you would qualify for disability, you should look into that.  and maybe nothing is really wrong, maybe your doctor is just being extra cautious. I know that's what my doctor is doing, because I was having preterm labor and my mom had my twin brothers at 6 months and me at 7 months and preterm labor can run in the family, they are just being extra careful. Just remember keeping those babies baking in there are the most important thing, and even though bed rest in boring, rest all you can now because in a few months you wont be getting any sleep.  I'm also on here ALL the time since I am at home, so if you ever need someone to talk to just find me here =) I hope things continue to go smoothly for you.
Congrats Shamanda - I'm glad they are all doing great.  Bed rest is boring, but it will be worth it in the end for those babies!!!!  Keep us posted.

Hey! Adding to what Peek said....there is  a website (I think it's for people on bedrest with Preeclampsia but regardless) that is FULL of ideas of things to do on bedrest! Turns out you can accomplish quite a bit from bed! My good frend was on hospitalized bedrest for several weeks so I just googled "things to do on bedrest" and the amount of answers I found were nuts!Good luck with the rest of the pregnancy! :) Do you know the sexes of the babies? (Sorry if I missed that post) The next 15 weeks will FLY by!!
money matter but the health of four is much more important congrats and take care of your and your babies health
Im sorry to hear that you can't work anymore.  But it is good that the babies are doing good!  It will be nice to be home.  I'll be done with work at 13 weeks and that seems so early!  Best of Luck!
I'm so glad to hear an update! I wonder about you often. I'm sorry about the no work, but you're right, it's best for all 4 of you. I hope the remainder goes very smoothly for you!

question: I'm nearly 25 weeks pregnant with triplets and so far things have been perfect.  I've been really lucky and have never had any complication and my babies are healthy.  I'm a teacher and my doctor agreed to let me go back to work, and today was the first day.  I had a dr. appt. after school and he decided that it isn't a good idea for me to work after this week.  I'm really disappointed, partly because I am going to lose a lot of money, but mostly I think because I had my hopes up that I could work longer and things would continue to go well.  This is kind of scary now, that it's getting serious enough to where I have to stop working.  I've been kind of emotional in general, so this is just really hard for me to deal with right now.  I know it's best for the babies and that's what's most important, but that's hard to remember when I don't feel sick or anything.  I don't really have a question, I just know and appreciate how supportive people one here are.  Thanks!
title: Triplet Pregnancy Update
